values.description: While testing a [formula for ogre 1.10 on osx](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/20310), I saw that its plugins do not have a `lib` prefix. In fact, the ogre1.9 formula does the same thing but [makes symlinks with the lib prefix](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ogre1.9.rb#L103-L111) to preserve backward compatibility. Since the gazebo8 formula has always used the ogre1.9 formula; I think we can safely discard the `lib` prefix for ogre plugins for gazebo8+.
values.title: Don't use lib prefix for ogre plugins as of ogre1.9

values.description:
Our shadows are subject to light space perspective warping which is not ideal when the camera view vector is coincident with the light direction vector. See this [ogre function description](http://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.8/class_ogre_1_1_li_s_p_s_m_shadow_camera_setup.html#a2a6fb5e0335458e5c626740bfcbfc56c) that tries to reduce the effect. However it was not sufficient for cases when the sun is at low angles. So  a new `CustomPSSMShadowCameraSetup` was added to bypass the perspective warping.  Most of the code in that class is taken from OGRE hence their licence header is kept in the source files.

To smooth out jagged edges in the shadows, hardware Percentage Closer Filtering (PCF) and Poisson disk sampling were added - though sometimes they are still obvious at certain angles.

Color of the shadows is now slightly darker than before to reduce the effect of built-in "ambient" light so that they are physically more accurate. 

Also bumped default shadow texture resolution to 2048 from 1024.

before:

![shadows_before.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3401938950-shadows_before.jpg)

after:

![shadows_after.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2226025022-shadows_after.jpg)

jenkins:

[homebrew](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1252/) - ok (`VisualProperty.CastShadows` test failure is a known problem after upgrading our homebrew gazebo7 jobs to ogre 1.9)

values.description:
Added lens flare post processing effect to cameras. It can be added to camera sensors using the `LensFlareSensorPlugin`. The effect works with a normal camera and a wide angle camera. When added, it finds the first directional light in the scene and renders lens flare at the projected 2D position in the camera image.

![lensflare.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1646467642-lensflare.jpg)

jenkins:

[homebrew](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1249/#showFailuresLink) - ok

values.description:
The PR builds on top of the feature introduced in this [sdf PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/373/add-light-as-child-of-link/diff) that supports the following new spec:

~~~
<link>
  <light>
      ....
  </light>
</link>
~~~

This is targeted at gazebo7. In order to preserve ABI, the protobuf msg definition has not been changed. As the result the scene (on the rendering side) does not get the link-light parent-child relationship. As a workaround, the lights on the rendering side are moved using the `~/pose/info` and `~/pose/local/info` topics. 

An example has been added to the `attach_lights.world`. The sphere model (not the double pendulum) has a light attached using the new SDF spec. 


jenkins:

[homebrew](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1257/) - ok
values.title: Add light as child of link

values.description:
Image Viewer does not display correctly grayscale images ("L_INT8"). They appear as random black and white pixels.
This is because the image data is copied into a QImage with format QImage::Format_Mono which has 1 bit per pixel.

This PR:
- fixes the format to use QImage::Format_Grayscale. 
- removes the L_INT16 case because there is no 16bits QImage format and that would lead to corrupted copy. 
- checks for changes in image format to reinit the qimage object
values.title: Image Viewer: fix QImage::Format used to display grayscale images

values.description:
While testing ROS code that uses gazebo as part of the testing suite, there is a segfault appearing during the teardown \([repo and instruction for reproducing the problem](https://github.com/osrf/mayfield_bug_15/)\) The test suite runs without gazebo GUI and if I enable it the segfault is gone. If the code is run under gdb the segfault is also not present.

The backtrace : [https://gist.github.com/j-rivero/7273acc73c0f10d4d5de009bf880a795](https://gist.github.com/j-rivero/7273acc73c0f10d4d5de009bf880a795)

My hypothesis is that it could be a race condition affecting the `newFrameConnection`event. The [newFrameConnection attribute is "Connected" in the Load method](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b4ea1ead18551e1e787183ed511e0b2810ef5e2a/plugins/CameraPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CameraPlugin.cc-71) but it is not being "disconnected" before destruction.

While testing ROS code that uses gazebo as part of the testing suite, there is a segfault appearing during the teardown \([repo and instruction for reproducing the problem](https://github.com/osrf/mayfield_bug_15/)\) The test suite runs without gazebo GUI and if I enable it the segfault is gone. If the code is run under gdb the segfault is also not present.

The backtrace : [https://gist.github.com/j-rivero/7273acc73c0f10d4d5de009bf880a795](https://gist.github.com/j-rivero/7273acc73c0f10d4d5de009bf880a795)

My hypothesis is that it could be a race condition affecting the `newFrameConnection`event. The [newFrameConnection attribute is "Connected" in the Load method](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b4ea1ead18551e1e787183ed511e0b2810ef5e2a/plugins/CameraPlugin.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CameraPlugin.cc-71) but it is not being "disconnected" before destruction.

With this PR the problem is gone although I'm not sure if the change proposed is the best of the solutions.
summary.html:
While testing ROS code that uses gazebo as part of the testing suite, there is a segfault appearing during the teardown (repo and instruction for reproducing the problem) The test suite runs without gazebo GUI and if I enable it the segfault is gone. If the code is run under gdb the segfault is also not present.

The backtrace : https://gist.github.com/j-rivero/7273acc73c0f10d4d5de009bf880a795

My hypothesis is that it could be a race condition affecting the newFrameConnectionevent. The newFrameConnection attribute is "Connected" in the Load method but it is not being "disconnected" before destruction.

With this PR the problem is gone although I'm not sure if the change proposed is the best of the solutions.

values.description:
The diagnostics class is useful for profiling performance, but it currently produces unwieldy results, storing every single measured timestamp, which can rapidly fill up a hard disk. This pull request reduces the output to a single set of statistics (mean,maxAbs,min,var) for each diagnostic timer. For the standalone diagnostics example added in pull request #2798, the output before and after this change is shown below:

~~~
example_world_stats 1512756096 973857946 3.21399
example_world_stats 1512756101 406463508 0.186995
example_world_stats 1512756101 606837814 0.387225
example_world_stats 1512756101 806248438 0.586562
example_world_stats 1512756102 7123061 0.78736
example_world_stats 1512756102 207537094 0.987699
example_world_stats 1512756102 408224670 1.18831
example_world_stats 1512756102 609667446 1.38965
example_world_stats 1512756102 809784876 1.58968
example_world_stats 1512756103 9455910 1.78928
example_world_stats 1512756103 210297429 1.99005
example_world_stats 1512756103 411116818 2.19078
example_world_stats 1512756103 611458526 2.39103
example_world_stats 1512756103 812158760 2.59164
example_world_stats 1512756104 12679870 2.79206
example_world_stats 1512756104 213363247 2.99258
example_world_stats 1512756104 411278253 3.19042
~~~


~~~
example_world_stats                               maxAbs 3.378315e-01   mean   1.993582e-01   min    4.560322e-02   var    2.856048e-03
~~~

When running gazebo with diagnostics, the World::Step function generates a file like the following:

~~~
World::Step                                       maxAbs 1.314529e-02   mean   1.129744e-03   min    6.468520e-04   var    1.535725e-07   
World::Step::update                               maxAbs 5.810080e-03   mean   1.004007e-03   min    5.608360e-04   var    1.335817e-07   
World::Step::sleepOffset                          maxAbs 1.137450e-04   mean   3.540239e-06   min    2.226000e-06   var    3.713906e-12   
World::Step::publishWorldStats                    maxAbs 1.002800e-04   mean   2.088615e-06   min    1.298000e-06   var    2.043211e-12   
World::Step::worldUpdateMutex                     maxAbs 1.211710e-04   mean   4.505201e-06   min    2.849000e-06   var    5.059674e-12   
World::Step::loadPlugins                          maxAbs 3.646100e-05   mean   4.860536e-07   min    2.790000e-07   var    2.757852e-13   
~~~

This also changes from continuous streaming to writing statistics when gazebo is shutdown. This reduces the I/O impact from diagnostics, but at some risk of the diagnostics output being lost if gazebo fails without shutting down properly.
values.title: Diagnostics: record timing statistics instead of all timestamps

values.description:
This fixes all xenial cppcheck errors! (I just noticed a [bunch in zesty](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-default-zesty-amd64-gpu-none/16/cppcheckResult/) :crying_cat_face:)

* 7212c4e: mark some gazebo/common constructors as explicit; basically anything that seemed reasonable and didn't cause any problems

* 221cf6b: suppress some noExplicitConstructor warnings about EnumIterator, SubMesh, Time, and URI constructors. The `SubMesh` one is a little weird because it's kinda like a copy constructor but it takes a pointer instead of an object. The [SubMesh class in ign-common](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/7a9b1ee092b5e7419722cd9de5dd205a56c09fba/include/ignition/common/SubMesh.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#SubMesh.hh-72) has a normal copy constructor, so I suppress the error instead of marking as explicit. The Time class uses the implicit constructor for double all over the place, so I gave suppressions to each of those constructors just to be safe. The `EnumIterator` and `URI` constructors also are used implicitly in a few places ([here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9840e93de641b5c1bc5ab9008be1817867a2ec3b/gazebo/physics/World.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-2923) for URI), so I gave them suppressions.

* fea2556: suppress unusedStructMember complaints in GpuLaserDataIterator.hh since they are used in another file

* fec2b8d: remove redundant assignment of copy variable

  • 7212c4e: mark some gazebo/common constructors as explicit; basically anything that seemed reasonable and didn't cause any problems

  • 221cf6b: suppress some noExplicitConstructor warnings about EnumIterator, SubMesh, Time, and URI constructors. The SubMesh one is a little weird because it's kinda like a copy constructor but it takes a pointer instead of an object. The SubMesh class in ign-common has a normal copy constructor, so I suppress the error instead of marking as explicit. The Time class uses the implicit constructor for double all over the place, so I gave suppressions to each of those constructors just to be safe. The EnumIterator and URI constructors also are used implicitly in a few places (here for URI), so I gave them suppressions.

  • fea2556: suppress unusedStructMember complaints in GpuLaserDataIterator.hh since they are used in another file

  • fec2b8d: remove redundant assignment of copy variable

values.description:
The [gazebo8 build is broken on homebrew](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_homebrew/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo8-homebrew-amd64/74/) since tinyxml2 version 6.0.0 was released with API changes (see [ign-common issue 28](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/28/build-fails-with-tinyxml2-60) for more info). Unfortunately tinyxml2 doesn't define macros with the major version, so we have to add our own definition based on the version detected from pkg-config.

I've already added this patch to the gazebo 8.2 bottles:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/330/commits/90fd1973ccf923cb35bbd40e2c917b45002522df

values.description:
The `Vector3d WideAngleCamera::Project(Vector3d)` function was added to gazebo7 in pull request #2806, but merging forward to gazebo8 in pull request #2827 caused a build failure. @iche033 noticed that `Vector2i Camera::Project(Vector3d)` was made a virtual function in gazebo8 (pull request #2572), which caused the failure since the new WideAngleCamera project function returns a different type.

To resolve this, the new WideAngleCamera `Project` function is renamed to `Project3d`. This is allowed since the new API hasn't been released yet. This change will be merged forward to gazebo8.

* Project to Project3d

* changelog
values.title: Rename WideAngleCamera::Project() -> Project3d() to fix gazebo8 API

values.description:
The plugin downloads map tiles using [Google Static Map API](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/intro) and creates a square, textured map model in the world using boxes.

![static_map_plugin.jpg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1805283998-static_map_plugin.jpg)

You'll need a Google API key. [Get it here](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/get-api-key). Just log in, create new project and you'll be given a key. Once you have a key, enter it into `worlds/static_map_plugin.world` and launch the world to see the above image.

nice-to-have's in the future:

* support rectangular shaped map model

* download map tiles in background
values.title: Add Static Map Plugin for creating textured map model

values.description:
The `Light::GetWorldPose` function was added in pull request #2807, but when trying to merge it forward to gazebo8, it causes a [build failure](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/717/) since the `Entity::GetWorldPose` function was made virtual in gazebo8 and returns a copy rather than a reference to a pose object.

~~~
gazebo/physics/Light.hh:69:41:
 error: conflicting return type specified for
 virtual const gazebo::math::Pose& gazebo::physics::Light::GetWorldPose() const
       public: virtual const math::Pose &GetWorldPose() const;
...
gazebo/physics/Entity.hh:123:47:
 error:   overriding virtual const gazebo::math::Pose gazebo::physics::Entity::GetWorldPose() const
       public: inline virtual const math::Pose GetWorldPose() const
~~~
values.title: fix Light::GetWorldPose API in preparation for merge from 7 -> 8

gazebo/physics/Light.hh:69:41:

values.description:
This merges pull request #2807 (attach light to link) and pull request #2805 (shadow improvements) forward to gazebo8. Since the `Entity::GetWorldPose` signature was changed in gazebo8 (ff6baf4) to return a copy instead of a reference, I added bfad93c which changes the `Light::GetWorldPose` signature and adds `Light::WorldPose`. I think I've fixed all the deprecation warnings.

This pull request is mostly checking CI, but I would like the bfad93c commit to be reviewed at least by @iche033.

Also, I see some comments about what to do when we can break ABI. Perhaps we can address those when merging forward to default.

values.description:
Builds on top of pull request #2838

While tackling issue #2390 (upgrade to `ignition::math::Color`), I couldn't help myself from tackling a lot of other issues I saw on `rendering::MovableText`:

* Remove boost
* PIMPL
* Document
* Implement functions which were only declared
* Deprecate `Get` functions
* Use `override`
* Add tests for setters and getters (the tests don't check the rendering results though)
* Add an example plugin
* :new: Removed unused private functions `getWorldOrientation` and `getWorldPosition`
* :new: Deprecated `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors` to conform to style

![movabletext.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/401554032-movabletext.gif)

~~Some things I didn't tackle:~~

~~* `getWorldOrientation` and `getWorldPosition` are private functions which are never used, I think we could delete them or at least change them to conform to our style~~
~~* The documentation on `_setupGeometry` and `_updateColors` implies they are overriding Ogre functions, but I don't think they are. We could then deprecate them and change their names so they conform to our style.~~
values.title: Updates to MovableText

summary.html:
Builds on top of pull request #2838

While tackling issue #2390 (upgrade to ignition::math::Color), I couldn't help myself from tackling a lot of other issues I saw on rendering::MovableText:

  • Remove boost
  • PIMPL
  • Document
  • Implement functions which were only declared
  • Deprecate Get functions
  • Use override
  • Add tests for setters and getters (the tests don't check the rendering results though)
  • Add an example plugin
  • Removed unused private functions getWorldOrientation and getWorldPosition
  • Deprecated _setupGeometry and _updateColors to conform to style

Some things I didn't tackle:

* getWorldOrientation and getWorldPosition are private functions which are never used, I think we could delete them or at least change them to conform to our style * The documentation on _setupGeometry and _updateColors implies they are overriding Ogre functions, but I don't think they are. We could then deprecate them and change their names so they conform to our style.

values.description:
Move BUILD_TYPE_* macros to test_config.h instead of gazebo_config.h to prevent symbol collisions with dart (issue #2343). The test_config.h header is installed, but it is expected to be used less than the gazebo_config.h.

Another option is to prefix the macros to be `GAZEBO_BUILD_TYPE_*`. I can implement this if it is preferred.

values.description:
There are ignition fuel tools headers used in [gazebo/common/FuelModelDatabase.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/918afe71c8e849e36bec7e1c16dee6f6053b1ba2/gazebo/common/FuelModelDatabase.hh?at=config_find_ign_fuel&fileviewer=file-view-default#FuelModelDatabase.hh-25), but fuel tools isn't yet exported as a dependency in cmake and pkgconfig. Now that the homebrew builds have fuel tools installed as a dependency, the examples and pkgconfig compilation tests are failing:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/289/testReport/

This should fix it without affecting the linux builds that don't have fuel tools yet.
values.title: Export dependency on ignition-fuel-tools if found

Now that the homebrew builds have fuel tools installed as a dependency, the examples and pkgconfig compilation tests are failing:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/289/testReport/

This should fix it without affecting the linux builds that don't have fuel tools yet.
summary.html:
There are ignition fuel tools headers used in gazebo/common/FuelModelDatabase.hh, but fuel tools isn't yet exported as a dependency in cmake and pkgconfig. Now that the homebrew builds have fuel tools installed as a dependency, the examples and pkgconfig compilation tests are failing:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/289/testReport/

This should fix it without affecting the linux builds that don't have fuel tools yet.
